article_title: Fact Checker: Ben Carson's claim that 'we have 10 times more people on welfare'
article_text:
Fact Checker: Ben Carson's claim that 'we have 10 times more people on welfare'

Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson has specifically made...

"The government programs have thrown money at poverty since the mid-'60s, $19 trillion. And we have 10 times more people on welfare, more people in poverty, more broken homes, more crimes."

og.description: Ben Carson, a neurosurgeon who is seeking the GOP presidential nomination, asserted in a television interview that government efforts to ease poverty have largely been a failure. He specifically made two claims - that $19 trillion has been spent on anti-poverty programs since the mid-1960s and that "we have 10 times more people on welfare." More generally, he also said that there are more people living in poverty.
og.title: Fact Checker: Ben Carson's claim that 'we have 10 times more people on welfare'

article_summary:
Fact Checker: Ben Carson's claim that 'we have 10 times more people on welfare'Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson has specifically made..."The government programs have thrown money at poverty since the mid-'60s, $19 trillion.
And we have 10 times more people on welfare, more people in poverty, more broken homes, more crimes."
